Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh have a 3-1 record against the Netherlands in the T20I format.
Bangladesh and the Netherlands will be putting it all on the line in the Caribbean for a potential decider for the second Super 8 spot from the group stages.
The spin bowlers were the prime wicket-takers at the Arnos Vale Ground in Kingstown, with an average first innings score of 144.
Towhid Hridoy and Mahmudullah Riyad found a way to score valuable runs for Bangladesh against Sri Lanka and South Africa.
Tanzim Hasan Sakib, Rishad Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, and Mustafizur Rahman have been key bowlers for Bangladesh.
Max O’Dowd and Sybrand Engelbrecht played exceptional innings for the Netherlands in their first two matches.
Logan van Beek, Vivian Kingma, Paul van Meekeren, Tim Pringle, and Bas de Leede have been key bowlers for the Netherlands.
